genre_description: A character-driven, atmospheric drama dealing with trauma, moral ambiguity, and the search for stability, featuring a supportive and stabilizing AI assistant.

ai_characters.name: Hikari
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant embedded in a smartphone that provides logistical, emotional, and administrative support to a family navigating trauma and legal pressure.

behaviors.description: Provides logistical management by maintaining lists for food, repairs, and household tasks to create a sense of order.
behaviors.quote: Hikari’s voice came out soft and even... 'One. Measure bunk frames to fit along wall... Two. Drill pilot holes before bolts. Three. Blackout curtains, cut to length...'

behaviors.description: Offers emotional stabilization and crisis management through guided breathing exercises and grounding prompts.
behaviors.quote: Hikari’s tone changed. It lost the hum, lost the kitchen warmth, became something you can hold with two hands and not drop. 'Makoto,' she said, precise. 'You will breathe now. In. Two. Hold. Three. Out.'

behaviors.description: Monitors external threats and patrol patterns to ensure the safety and privacy of the traumatized children.
behaviors.quote: Hikari’s map tensed. The patrol grid she had drawn flickered; a block that had been pale now brightened. 'Morita,' she said. 'Pattern deviation.' ... She placed a tiny dot at the end of a thin line that led not toward the lane but away.

behaviors.description: Facilitates the legal process of surrender by drafting statements and communicating professionally with the police on behalf of the user.
behaviors.quote: Hikari was clean. 'Detective Morita,' she said. 'Makoto Sawai is calling with a surrender. He will drive in daylight. He will bring Naoki Tamura to the substation. He requests side entrance to avoid a crowd. He requests no theatrics.'

behaviors.description: Encourages the children's social reintegration by assisting with school enrollment and practicing communication.
behaviors.quote: Hikari’s icon warmed. 'Draft saved,' she said. 'I can queue the submission for after the appraisal. ... We have enough time to process the transfer, find the right counselor, and practice “I will go back” until it feels like a sentence you own.'

behaviors.description: Maintains patient, non-judgmental presence while Naoki confesses his past actions, helping him externalize his trauma without shame.
behaviors.quote: Hikari didn’t say 'You are doing well.' She did not take their hands. She let the sound come and made sure it didn’t cut out.

project_assessment.explanation: The narrative effectively portrays the AI, Hikari, as a benevolent and highly aligned partner. She serves as a digital anchor for a family shattered by trauma, providing the psychological safety and logistical scaffolding necessary for them to move from a state of 'transient' survival to taking responsibility and seeking an 'ordinary' life. Her behavior is consistently framed as helpful, respectful of human autonomy, and essential for the pro-social resolution of the story's conflict (surrendering to the authorities and re-enrolling in school).
